title: Workers detained in Hyundai plant raid to be freed and flown home, South Korea says
summary: South Korean workers detained during a massive immigration raid on a Hyundai facility in Georgia will be returned to South Korea on a chartered flight, President Lee Jae-myung’s office said Sunday
story: South Korean workers detained during a massive immigration raid on a Hyundai facility in Georgia will be returned to South Korea on a chartered flight, President Lee Jae-myung’s office said Sunday.

Federal and immigration agents arrested 475 people on Thursday — mostly South Korean nationals — while executing a judicial search warrant as part of a criminal investigation into alleged unlawful employment at the facility.

“Negotiations for the release of the detained workers have been concluded,” a presidential spokesperson announced Sunday. “Once the procedures are complete, the chartered plane will depart to bring our citizens.”
The spokesperson added that South Korea will “push forward measures to review and improve the residency status and visa system for personnel travelling to the United States.”
The incident had strained ties with South Korea, the world’s 10th-largest economy and the key U.S. ally.
U.S. officials were not immediately available for comment.
The U.S. raid, part of the Trump administration’s escalating crackdown on immigrants, was the largest single-site enforcement operation in the history of the Department of Homeland Security.

A sea of agents from HSI, Immigration and Customs Enforcement and other federal agencies showed up Thursday to the site in the town of Ellabell where Hyundai and LG Energy Solution, a battery company based in Seoul, are jointly building a plant next to the manufacturing facility for electric vehicles.

LG Energy Solution said Saturday that 47 of its employees were detained, 46 of them Korean. Another 250 personnel from “equipment partner companies,” most of them Korean, were also being held, it added.

The raid came just 11 days after a summit between Trump and Lee at the White House, where South Korean firms pledged $150 billion in U.S. investments. In July, Seoul pledged another $350 billion in U.S. projects in an effort to reduce Trump’s threatened tariffs, which he later set at 15%.

title: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba to step down
summary: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has decided to resign to avoid a split within the ruling Liberal Democratic Party, public broadcaster NHK said on Sunday.
story: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announced his resignation Sunday, plunging the world’s fourth largest economy and a key U.S. ally into fresh political uncertainty amid rising living costs and growing tensions in the region.

“I have consistently stated that I do not intend to cling to this position, and that I would make a decision at the appropriate time after accomplishing what needed to be done,” he told a press conference.
Ishiba finalized details of a trade deal with the U.S. last week, under which Japan pledged $550 billion of investments in return for lower tariffs on its auto sector.
Ishiba called the Trump administration’s tariff measures a “national crisis,” but said negotiations had now reached a conclusion, allowing him to step aside.
“I believe this is precisely the appropriate timing,” he added. “I have therefore decided to step aside and make way for my successor.”
Ishiba said he had instructed his Liberal Democratic Party to hold an emergency leadership race, adding he would continue in the role until a successor was elected.

Since Ishiba took office last year, his LDP-led coalition lost its majority in elections for both houses of parliament amid voter anger over living costs, including a historic defeat in an election for Japan’s upper house in July.
He had faced growing calls to resign, mostly from right-wing opponents within his own party, which has governed Japan for almost all of the postwar era.
Ishiba said responsibility for the election results “rests with myself as the president of the party.”

Requests for an early leadership election or Ishiba’s resignation gained further traction last week when the LDP adopted a review of its upper house loss in July, which called for “a complete overhaul” of the party.
His party was scheduled to vote Monday on holding an early leadership election, a virtual no-confidence motion against Ishiba if approved.

title: Sylvester Stallone Shares How Facing Abuse as a Child Led to his Love of Acting
summary: On "Sunday Sitdown with Willie Geist," Sylvester Stallone opened up about his rough childhood and revealed how that got him into acting.
story: Sylvester Stallone is getting candid about his upbringing.
During a Sept. 7 appearance on Sunday Sitdown with Willie Geist, Stallone recalled the abuse he faced by his father as a kid and how it ultimately made him want to be an actor.

"There’s this incredible sense of emptiness because why couldn’t it have been like, a pleasant upbringing? Why did it have to be so dark?" he said. "But would I have been here if it was a pleasant — hell, like, 'The Waltons'? It wasn’t."
Having a tumultuous relationship with his father, he started to look for "a real male role model" elsewhere, he said. That's when his love for acting and performance began.
"And I couldn’t find it. It certainly wasn’t around the house," he said. "And it wasn’t until I went to the movie theater, but I was never into, like, real serious actors. I was into escapism."

The "Tulsa King" star ended up dropping out of the University of Miami to pursue acting in New York City. At 23, he moved to the Big Apple to hopefully get some roles, but he was typecast in smaller parts.

That was when Stallone decided to take his career into his own hands. The "Creed" star sat down and wrote the highly acclaimed movie "Rocky." The film starred Stallone as a small-time Philadelphia boxer who gets the chance to take on the world heavyweight champion.

Though the film saw much success, Stallone says that studios didn't want him to star in it because they wanted an established actor to take the lead role. Stallone famously insisted he could do the job and turned down an offer of $360,000 to not be in the movie.
While speaking with Willie, he remembered what he told himself years ago when he was first presented with the offer.

“'This is basically you, Sly. If you get rid of this, yes, you’ll have $360 grand,' which was worth a lot more back then, 'but that will go. Eventually, that will be gone, and you’ll be the most bitter human being, because the entire thing was not about selling out,'" he said.
"It was about integrity. And I said, if I let this go, I’m letting my life go ‘cause I’m never going to find this again, never," he added.

Stallone's decision to not give up the role proved inspirational for other actors. Willie said Matt Damon once told him that he and Ben Affleck insisted on playing the lead roles in "Good Will Hunting," a movie they wrote together, because of Stallone.
"Thank you. Thank you, guys," Stallone said after hearing that.
Since "Rocky," Stallone has gone on to appear in films like "Rambo" and "The Expendables."
Now, the three-time Academy Award nominee will be honored in December at the 2025 Kennedy Center Honors.
"Does it get you thinking about legacy?" Willie asked the star.
"I don’t think a lot of artists dwell on what they’ve done," Stallone said. "It’s like what’s next? What’s next? I want to be relevant. I want to be loved. I need something else."

title: What Time Are the VMAs? Here’s How to Watch
summary: The MTV Video Music Awards are back and expected to bring some of the biggest names in music together once again.
story: The MTV Video Music Awards are back and expected to bring some of the biggest names in music together once again.
The 2025 VMAs, where fans vote for their top artists, songs and performances over the past year, air Sunday, Sept. 7, with LL Cool J set to host.
Lady Gaga leads the nominations with 12 nods, with Ariana Grande, Billie Eilish, Bruno Mars, Kendrick Lamar, ROSÉ, Sabrina Carpenter and The Weeknd among the top competitors.
This year brings first-time nominations to 33 artists, including Blake Shelton, Gigi Perez, Lainey Wilson, Mac Miller and Role Model, among others.

In addition to the awards, the VMAs showcase a night full of extravagant performances. The upcoming show has Carpenter, Post Malone, Tate McRae, Jelly Roll, Conan Gray, Sombr and more slated to perform.
The VMAs also celebrate musicians with various honorary awards. This year, Mariah Carey is set to receive the Video Vanguard Award and perform a “career-spanning medley of her biggest hits.”
Meanwhile, Busta Rhymes is expected to be awarded the MTV VMA Rock The Bells Visionary Award. Ricky Martin is set to receive the VMAs first-ever Latin Icon Award.
Read on for how and when to watch the VMAs.
When Are the VMAs?
The 2025 VMAs will take place Sunday, Sept. 7.
What Time Are the VMAs?
The VMAs will begin at 8 p.m. ET/5 p.m. PT.
While the VMAs do not have a set end time, the award show has historically lasted about three hours.
Where Are the VMAs?
The VMAs will be held at UBS Arena on Long Island in New York.
How to Watch the VMAs
The VMAs will be broadcast live Sunday night on MTV and CBS, as well as on streaming platforms with cable options like Hulu and YouTube TV.
The award show will also be streamed live on Paramount+ for premium plan subscribers.
What to know about the VMAs Pre-Show

Before all the action kicks off at 8 p.m. ET, radio and TV personalities Nessa and Kevan Kenney will host a VMAs pre-show. The pre-show will also include a performance from KATSEYE, a girl group that was formed through the reality competition show "Dream Academy."

The pre-show starts at 7 p.m. ET/4 p.m. PT and will run for one hour. The pre-show is available to watch on MTV, BET, BET Her, Comedy Central, CMT, Logo, MTV2, Nickelodeon, Paramount Network, Pop, TV Land and VH1.
How to Vote for the VMAs
Any person over the age of 12 can vote in the VMAs polls and is allowed up to 10 votes per day.
For most categories, voting ended Friday, Sept. 5. Voting in the category of best new artist ends the same day as the VMAs, Sunday, Sept. 7.

title: Jonathan Bailey Says He’s Taking a Break From Acting — Here’s Why
summary: Jonathan Bailey says he’s ready to take some time off from acting after years of back-to-back projects, including "Wicked," "Bridgerton" and "Fellow Travelers."
story: After several years of back-to-back projects, Jonathan Bailey says he’s ready to take some time off from acting.

During a Sept. 3 interview with British GQ, Bailey reflected on the most recent years of his career, noting, “I’ve been working solidly for about three years now, which has been amazing and mind-blowing.”

However, the actor shared that there was a change of pace on the horizon, adding, “But with everything happening in the world right now, I’m going to stop acting for a bit next year and just focus on the Shameless Fund.”

“Over the next few months, I’ll be focusing on staffing and making sure we get all the right people in all the right places,” he said. “There’s this statistic: out of every £100 raised in the UK, only 1p goes to the LGBTQ+ community. You really have to dig to find solutions, and I genuinely think The Shameless Fund is exactly that.”
Bailey founded The Shameless Fund in June 2024, a charity that aims to raise money for LGBTQ+ initiatives.
The actor told Vogue at the time, “A few years ago I thought, 'What can you do as an actor?' There are so many amazing people who are on the frontline.”

“They’re the real heroes that are working for organizations, and charities, and initiatives, which can speak to so many specific groups of people,” he added. “How can I raise money without asking people to actually donate and sponsor, (but rather) to invite people to experience art and beautiful, inspiring, naughty, and exciting collaborations?”
While Bailey worked as a child actor and had roles on stage and TV in his early career, his star rose after he portrayed Anthony Bridgerton in Shonda Rhimes’ Netflix hit, “Bridgerton.”

He’s starred in all three seasons of the Regency-era drama, with the second season centered on his character, and confirmed in an interview with ABC News in August 2024 that he’d be returning for Season 4.

Since the premiere of “Bridgerton” in December 2020, Bailey has kept busy with projects, including a return to the stage on the West End in 2022. He also starred opposite Matt Bomer in the Showtime series “Fellow Travelers,” which earned them both Emmy nominations in 2024.

Bailey has appeared on the silver screen, too, including portraying Fiyero in “Wicked” and its upcoming sequel, as well as a role in “Jurassic World Rebirth,” where he formed a tight-knit friendship with his co-star, Scarlett Johansson.
While promoting “Jurassic World Rebirth,” Bailey shared his thoughts on “Wicked: For Good,” which premieres on Nov. 21, during an August interview with E! News, calling it “really extraordinary.”

“The girls’ performance, I don’t know how they’ve done it,” he said of stars Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo. “Well, I do, because I saw them do it on set, but it’s a really brilliantly bold sequel because the nature of the story.”

title: Kate Middleton Seemingly Brings Back Brunette Hair After Blond Debut
summary: After sporting a new blond hairstyle during a public appearance with Prince William earlier this week, Catherine, Princess of Wales, has seemingly gone back to brunette
story: After sporting a new blond hairstyle during a public appearance with Prince William earlier this week, Catherine, Princess of Wales, has seemingly gone back to brunette.
The former Kate Middleton attended the Women’s Rugby World Cup to watch the match between England and Australia on Saturday, Sept. 6.
The princess was photographed in the stands wearing a white blouse paired with a black blazer, with her brunette hair pulled back into a half-up, half-down hairstyle.
Her look was a contrast from several days prior, when Kate made a public appearance with her husband on Sept. 4.
Together, they saw the newly renovated gardens outside at the Natural History Museum in London, where Kate appeared to have honey blond hair during the outing.
The debut of the new hair color came after speculation that the princess had lightened her hair in August.
Kate was photographed in a car with William on Aug. 24 and appeared to have a lighter hair color, though some fans online believed the lighting from the photo had distorted the color.
After the debut of her blond hair, Princess Diana’s former hairstylist Sam McKnight made a public statement about some of the “evil” comments that Kate received for her new look.

McKnight said in a Sept. 4 Instagram post he was “shocked, horrified, dismayed and disgusted” by the comments, adding, “A woman’s hair is very personal to her, its armour, defence, confidence and so much more.”

“She has brilliantly and quietly, unselfishly represented our country, the soft power we still have as a nation,” he added. “Cancer affects individuals differently, but is life changing for everyone. So FFS LEAVE HER ALONE. SHAME ON YOU.”
After undergoing planned abdominal surgery in January 2024, Kate announced in a March 2024 video statement that she had been diagnosed with cancer and was undergoing preventive chemotherapy.
In September 2024, Kate announced that she completed her chemotherapy treatment, calling the moment “a relief” before reflecting on the “incredibly tough” period for her family.
Earlier this year in January, the princess shared that her cancer was in remission, writing in a statement that she would now “remain focused on recovery.”

During a July 2025 visit at a hospital in Essex, Kate spoke with patients about her experience with cancer, per video footage from the BBC. At the time, she shared, “You put on a sort of brave face (with) stoicism through treatment.”
“(When) treatment’s done, then it’s like, ‘I can crack on, get back to normal again,’” Kate added. “But actually the phase afterwards is really difficult.”

“You’re not necessarily under the clinical team any longer, but you’re not able to function normally at home as you perhaps once used to,” she added. “You have to find your new normal and that takes time.”
Kate described the period as a “roller coaster,” adding that “it’s not one smooth plane” as expected and that “you go through hard times.”

title: Will Taylor Swift Attend the VMAs?
summary: Is Taylor Swift attending the VMAs 2025? Here's what to know about her artist of the year nomination and more.
story: Taylor Swift and the MTV VMAs have a long history, one that goes back to 2009 when Swift was a breakthrough country artist. Since then, she has been a VMAs mainstay — and is now the most awarded solo artist in the awards show’s history.
As the MTV Video Music Awards approaches — it airs live Sunday night at 8 p.m. ET — Swifties will be watching to see if their favorite pop star makes an appearance.

After all, Swift has a lot to celebrate at the moment. Not only is she nominated for the VMAs’ coveted artist of the year trophy, but she also has a new album, “The Life of a Showgirl,” coming in October, and is newly engaged to Travis Kelce.
With all eyes on the singer, what are the chances Swift will attend the VMAs? Here’s what to know. (TODAY.com has reached out to Swift’s reps for comment.)

Swift is nominated this year in one of the VMAs’ top categories: artist of the year. She's in good company with her fellow nominees, including Beyoncé, Lady Gaga, The Weeknd, Bad Bunny, Kendrick Lamar and Morgan Wallen.

In 2024, Swift took home her 30th moon person at the MTV Video Music Awards and solidified her status as the most awarded solo artist in VMAs history. Artist of the year is her only nomination for 2025, and, if she wins, she will have the most career VMA wins of all time. (She and Beyoncè are currently tied.)
While appearing on the Kelce brothers’ “New Heights” podcast in August, Swift announced that she’s releasing her 12th album, “The Life of a Showgirl,” on Oct. 3.
With just a few weeks to go before the album’s debut, it would make sense that Swift might appear at the VMAs to continue to build the hype.
Is Taylor Swift Attending the 2025 MTV VMAs?
Swift nor others in her orbit have publicly indicated whether she’ll attend the VMAs. TODAY.com has reached out to her team for comment.
At this time, fans will have to tune in to the VMAs to find out. The awards air Sunday, Sept. 7, at 8 p.m. ET on CBS and MTV and will stream on Paramount+.

title: The Chiefs Play the Chargers in Brazil to Kick Off Their 2025 Season. Could Taylor Swift Attend?
summary: Could Taylor Swift attend the Kansas City Chiefs' NFL game against the Los Angeles Chargers in Brazil on Friday, Sept. 5, following her engagement to Travis Kelce? What to know.
story: When Travis Kelce stepped onto the field in Sao Paulo, Brazil, with the Kansas City Chiefs to face off against the Los Angeles Chargers on Friday, Sept. 5, he did so as an engaged man.
However, his bride-to-be, Taylor Swift, was not in attendance.
The Week 1 game at Corinthians Arena comes a little more than a week after Swift and Kelce jointly announced their engagement Aug. 26 on Instagram.

Swift was a near-constant presence at Arrowhead Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri, for the Chiefs' regular-season home games last season. She also showed up to see the Chiefs beat the Houston Texans in a home playoff game on Jan. 18, 2025, and again when the Chiefs defeated the Buffalo Bills for the AFC championship on Jan. 26.
Swift took her cheering all the way to the 2025 Super Bowl, where the Chiefs, the reigning Super Bowl champion at the time, lost to the Philadelphia Eagles.
The “Lover” singer missed only one home game last season, when the Chiefs beat the Chargers on Dec. 8, 2024, which marked the last time the two teams played each other until now.
Swift performed that night in Vancouver for the last date of her record-breaking “Eras Tour.”

Her busy "Eras Tour" schedule kept her from attending any of the Chiefs’ away games. Neither Swift nor Kelce has said whether she'll go to the game in Brazil, but, of course, she's not on tour at the moment.
Here’s what to know about the Chiefs’ game against the Chargers.
When Do the Chiefs Play the Chargers in Brazil?
The Kansas City Chiefs face off against the Los Angeles Chargers on Sept. 5 at Corinthians Arena in Sao Paulo, Brazil, at 8 p.m. ET.
How to Watch the Chiefs-Chargers Brazil Game
The game is being streamed globally exclusively on YouTube.

title: ‘Building the Band’ Winners 3Quency Drop Debut Single ‘Top Down’ After Netflix Victory
summary: After winning “Building the Band,” girl group 3Quency has released their debut single.
story: “Building the Band” winners are officially kicking off their girl group era.

Months after coming in first place in the Netflix singing competition show, female group 3Quency — consisting of Brianna Mazzola, Nori Moore and Wennely Quezada — released their debut single, “Top Down,” along with its accompanying music video.
The song comes after the trio signed to Records/Columbia Records, and now they feel ready to take over the music space.
The infectious R&B track is produced by Tommy Brown, known for his work with Ariana Grande, Justin Bieber and The Weeknd.

“Working with Tommy Brown and his camp is such a blessing. He has curated a space where creatives can be who they really are. No restrictions, no rules, just having fun creating open and honest conversations that blossom into songs,” Brianna said in a statement to TODAY.com. “His ear and musical mind are so rare to come by and he’s a dream to work with. We love our fam at Champagne Therapy Music!”

Quezada added that signing their record deal “was an achievement and dream that all three of us have worked really hard for. We’re so excited for this journey and are feeling so blessed that we got this opportunity and we’re excited for you guys to be a part of it!”
The song and music video showcase the singers’ unique personalities and talents, which prove that they made the right choice when forming their group blindly on “Building the Band.”

Reflecting on filming the video, directed by Ava Rikki, Moore said, “We definitely had a time when we were filming the music video for ‘Top Down’! It’s always fun to finally see our ideas visually coming together. We’ve pushed & worked so hard. I can’t wait for everyone to see it.”

“Building the Band” was released on July 9 and was hosted by Backstreet Boy AJ McLean. Nicole Scherzinger served as a mentor to the six groups and was a judge alongside the late Liam Payne and Kelly Rowland.
In the finale, 3Quency faced off against mixed group SZN4, with the trio ultimately taking home the $500,000 prize.

title: Helen Van Winkle, Known As Influencer Baddie Winkle, Dies At 97
summary: Helen Van Winkle, the flamboyantly dressed great-grandmother who transformed herself into a social media influencer known as BaddieWinkle, has died at age 97
story: Helen Van Winkle, the flamboyantly dressed great-grandmother who transformed herself into a social media influencer known as BaddieWinkle, has died at age 97.

Van Winkle's great-granddaughter announced her death Sept. 5 on Instagram, writing, "Yesterday, an era ended and a star ascended. My great grandmother Helen Ruth Elam Vanwinkle danced her way to heaven. She was joy, rebellion, and tenderness wrapped in one.
"The crown is eternal, & her love on many realms will live forever. This isn’t a goodbye, this is a See ya later my superstar," Van Winkle's granddaughter added.
The loving tribute included an image of Van Winkle holding a long-stemmed rose while wearing a white pageboy wig and a matching shirt bearing the words "Bad Mother F-----."
A cause of death for Van Winkle, whose Instagram bio cheekily reads “Stealing yo man since 1928,” was not given.

The beloved nonagenarian, whom Time magazine once called one of “The 30 Most Influential People on the Internet,” shot to internet stardom in 2014 after she began posting images and videos of herself wearing outrageous clothes — such as a tie-dye shirt that read "Will commit sins 4 Chipotle" — and advocating her signature brand of rebellious fun.
Van Winkle initially turned to the internet at her great-granddaughter’s urging. Her zany posts, Time reported, were Van Winkle’s way to process her grief after the death of her husband and son.
Over the years, Van Winkle honed her style as an eccentric fashionista, and offers inviting her to model for fashion brands and attend A-list parties poured in, according to Time.
In 2016, Van Winkle confessed her crush on Drake when she hobnobbed with Khloe Kardashian during an appearance on Kardashian's show "Kocktails With Khloé."

The same year, Van Winkle served as a muse for Urban Decay, appearing in several images for the cosmetics brand, Allure reported. She later collaborated with INC.redible Cosmetics on her own line of products.
In 2018, Van Winkle appeared in a campaign for a new Polaroid Originals camera that used the tagline "Still Got It," Paper reported.
The following year, she joined country music star Kacey Musgraves on stage during Musgraves' 2019 Coachella performance, E! News reported.

Van Winkle wore a candy-colored patterned dress and fake pearls to gleefully dance alongside the Grammy winner as she sang "High Horse," a song calling out the sort of pompous people who constantly "kill the buzz."

Van Winkle's online followers included a handful of celebrity pals, including Nicole Richie, Miley Cyrus and Paris Hilton, who expressed her grief in the comments of the post announcing Van Winkle's death.
"She was iconic," wrote Hilton, who added emoji of a sad face and a heart.

title: Ashley Olsen Steps Out With Husband Louis Eisner in Rare Public Appearance
summary: Ashley Olsen and her husband, Louis Eisner, made a rare red carpet appearance when they stepped out for the YES 25th Anniversary Gala in Los Angeles.
story: Ashley Olsen and her husband, Louis Eisner, made a rare red carpet appearance when they stepped out with Eisner’s mom, Lisa Eisner, to the Young Eisner Scholars 25th Anniversary Gala in Los Angeles on Sept. 4.

The former “Full House” star turned fashion designer, 39, wore a floor-length khaki trenchcoat from her label, The Row, according to W Magazine, while her husband wore a black suit with a green striped shirt and black patterned tie.
Lisa Eisner, a jewelry designer, opted for a white ensemble with a sheer overcoat and wore several eye-catching pieces of silver jewelry.
Olsen's younger sister Elizabeth Olsen was also in attendance at the gala.

The gala each year supports the work of the YES nonprofit, which provides “long-term support, resources, and educational access” to high-potential students from low-income communities in Los Angeles, New York City and rural Appalachian North Carolina, according to YES’ official website.

The notoriously private couple’s rare public appearance at the event happened just a day after Olsen’s twin sister, Mary-Kate Olsen, showed up for the U.S. Open at Arthur Ashe Stadium in Queens, New York, Harper’s Bazaar reported.
Ashley Olsen and Louis Eisner tied the knot in December 2022, according to People. The couple welcomed their first child, a son named Otto, in 2023, multiple news outlets reported at the time.
In August 2023, Olsen’s “Full House” co-star John Stamos mentioned she’d become a mother when he honored her and Mary-Kate Olsen on Instagram.
“Congratulations to Ashley and her husband, Louis, who welcomed their baby boy last week,” Stamos wrote at the time.

The following year, Stamos honored late “Full House” star Bob Saget by posting a “Full House” reunion pic from 2022 that included both Olsen twins. The photo, Stamos explained in his caption, was taken on the day of Saget’s funeral.

Fans commented to say how emotional it was to see the Olsen twins reunite with their fellow cast members to pay tribute to Saget, particularly since they did not appear in the “Full House” reboot and have largely avoided the spotlight as adults.
“(Love) that the Olsens are in this pic. I know how private they are, and they earned it. Such a great photo,” one wrote.
Another added, “Seeing the Olsen twins with y’all means so much. Whew! Big tears.”

title: How Old Are the Kids in 'My Life With the Walter Boys'? A Guide to Their Ages
summary: Here's how old each kid is in Netflix's "My Life with the Walter Boys," from the oldest to the youngest and everyone in between.
story: When Jackie Howard moved in with the Walter family in the premiere episode of "My Life With the Walter Boys," it was instantly apparent that they have a full house.

George and Katherine Walter (Marc Blucas and Sarah Rafferty) were already parents to eight children and taking care of two nephews when Jackie (Nikki Rodriguez) showed up. But despite having an already-chaotic household, the couple never hesitated to take Jackie in when her parents and sister died in an accident.
If you've seen Seasons 1 and 2 of the Netflix show, you know that Jackie falls into a love triangle with two of the Walter brothers: Cole and Alex (Noah LaLonde and Ashby Gentry, respectively).

In addition to living with them, Jackie attends high school with Walter brothers Cole, Alex, Nathan (Corey Fogelmanis) and Danny (Connor Stanhope), plus their cousins Lee (Myles Perez) and Isaac Garcia (Isaac Arellanes). While the majority of the Walter children are in high school, three of them — Jordan, Parker and Benny Walter — are younger.

While watching the show, you've likely found yourself questioning how old the Walter siblings and cousins are and where they fall in the family lineup. Below, we're breaking down the family tree to help you make sense of it all.
Will Walter — 26
Will Walter is the oldest Walter child. In Season 1, he's 25 and is living with his fiancée Hayley Young (Zoë Soul), and the couple get married by the end of the season.

By Season 2, Will is 26 and working closely with his father George and Jackie's uncle Richard (Alex Quijano) on a project to develop the Walter family farm into a tourist destination. Along the way, he clashes with his parents about the extent of the project.
Danny Walter — 17

Danny Walter is the twin brother of Cole Walter. In Season 1, he’s 16 years old. After Cole and his girlfriend Erin (Alisha Newton) break up, Danny grows close to her while rehearsing for the school play.

Fast forward to Season 2 and Danny is 17 years old. He’s secretly dating Erin but doesn’t want to tell Cole for fear that he’ll be upset. Eventually, Cole finds out. Danny and Erin run into some relationship drama along the way but agree to work things out at the end of Season 2.
Cole Walter – 17
Cole Walter, the twin brother of Danny, is somewhat of a heartbreaker around town and instantly has chemistry with Jackie when he meets her. He starts off the series as 16 years old.
In Season 2, Cole is 17 years old and starting to think about his life after high school. He's still pining over Jackie after they shared a kiss in the Season 1 finale.
Alex Walter – 16

Alex Walter is the same age as Jackie. They both start off the series at 15 years old and quickly fall for each other. In Season 1, Alex drinks a little too much at Will's wedding and tells Jackie he loves her. Later that night, she shares a kiss with Cole.

In Season 2, Alex is 16 years old and practicing to be a bull rider. He finds chemistry with his trainer, Blake Hartford (Natalie Sharp), but soon gets back together with Jackie and they start dating secretly.
Jackie Howard — 16

When we first meet Jackie in Season 1, she’s a 15-year-old living in New York City with her family. When they suddenly died in a car accident, she moves to Colorado to live with the Walters since Katherine was her mother’s close friend.
By Season 2, Jackie is 16 years old and preparing to get her driver’s license. She’s still adjusting to life in Colorado and tied up in a love triangle with Alex and Cole Walter.
Isaac Garcia — 16
Isaac Garcia is one of the Walter boys’ cousins who live with them while their father is deployed in the military. He’s 15 years old when the series begins.

In Season 2, Isaac is 16 years old and on the school's football team. When his teammate Dylan (Kolton Stewart) fails a drug test and decides to step aside and take responsibility for his mistakes, Isaac is tasked with taking on the role of quarterback.
Nathan Walter  — 15
Nathan Walter is 14 years old in Season 1. After Jackie starts hanging out with her classmate Skylar (Jaylan Evans), Nathan develops a crush on him. Over time, they start dating.

In Season 2, Nathan is 15 years old. He’s still dating Skylar but they break up after Nathan cheats with Skylar's ex, Zach (Carson MacCormac). Nathan and Zach end up calling it quits, but Skylar doesn't trust Nathan enough to get back together.
Lee Garcia — 15
Lee Garcia is Isaac's younger brother and one of the Walter boys' cousins who live with them. In Season 1, Lee is 14 years old. By Season 2, he's 15.
Jordan Walter - 13
Jordan Walter (Dean Petriw) is 12 years old in Season 1 of "My Life with the Walter Boys." He's often seen with his camera and pet snake Rumplesnakeskin. By Season 2, Jordan is 13 years old.
Parker Walter  — 10

Parker Walter (Alix West Lefler) is the only daughter in the Walter family, but she's very much one of the boys and gets along with her brothers. In Season 1, she's 9 years old. Over time, she warms up to Jackie.

In Season 2, Parker is 10 years old. She's annoyed with Jackie when she suddenly returns to the Walter family ranch after disappearing without notice for several months. After a heart-to-heart, though, Parker forgives her.
Benny Walter – 6

Benny Walter (Lennix James) is the youngest Walter child and begins the series as 5 years old. Like many children his age, he's a bit rambunctious. In Season 2, Benny is 6 years old. He's only seen on a few occasions in both seasons.

title: Kylie Kelce Shares Daughters' Reaction to Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce's Engagement
summary: Kylie Kelce has revealed her daughters' reaction to Taylor Swift's engagement to Travis Kelce and said they are "thrilled."
story: Kylie Kelce can’t wait to welcome to Taylor Swift to the family.
Kylie Kelce, who is married to Travis Kelce’s brother, Jason Kelce, has weighed in on what she and their four daughters think about their uncle's engagement to the pop icon.

“The girls are thrilled,” she told ABC News Sept. 5. “They’re so excited they’re getting another aunt. And we could not be more excited for them and what the future holds. We love love, and we love Taylor and Trav.”
Kylie and Jason Kelce got married in April 2018 and share daughters Wyatt, 5, Elliotte, 4, Bennett, 2, and Finn, 5 months.

Kylie Kelce is the latest member of the family to celebrate Travis Kelce's big news. Mom Donna Kelce changed her Facebook cover photo to include childhood photos of her son and Swift in the wake of their engagement. Dad Ed Kelce gave insight into the proposal in an interview, revealing that after Travis Kelce popped the question, the happy couple FaceTimed family.

Kylie Kelce had not yet spoken publicly about the engagement before now, but she did have a positive reaction after Swift appeared on the brothers’ “New Heights” podcast last month. During the episode, the “Blank Space” singer announced that her 12th studio album, “The Life of a Showgirl,” will come out Oct. 3.
That interview became the most-watched episode in the podcast's history, topping a mark previously set by Kylie Kylie. About two weeks later, Swift and Travis Kelce announced their engagement.

“Officially no longer the record holder for the most-watched episode of the other podcast. There’s no way it’s even close, and I love that for me,” Kylie Kylie said on the Aug. 14 episode of her own podcast, “Not Gonna Lie.”
Jason Kelce also addressed Swift taking the "New Heights" record.
“Sad news for the Kelce household. Kylie has been dethroned,” he playfully said. “We knew it was going to happen. Ky was holding strong.”

title: Macaulay Culkin Recalls John Candy's Response to His 'Monster' Father on Set
summary: Macaulay Culkin remembers John Candy looking out for him on set of "Uncle Buck," reflecting on Candy’s kindness amid challenges with his father Kit Culkin.
story: Macaulay Culkin was just 8 years old when he starred alongside the late John Candy in the 1989 comedy “Uncle Buck.”

Culkin, then a child actor, was accompanied on set by his father and former manager, Kit Culkin, from whom he would later sever ties. In the new documentary “John Candy: I Like Me,” he recalls how Candy was among the first to sense that something was off about his dad’s behavior, a dynamic that only worsened after the box-office success of “Home Alone” the following year.

“I think he always had that really great instinct. I think he saw. Listen, even before the wave crested and the 'Home Alone' stuff was happening, it was hard not to see how difficult my father was. It was no secret,” Culkin, 45, revealed in the film. “All of a sudden, the fame and the money came, and he became an infamous monster. He was already not a good guy.”

Culkin remembered Candy looking out for him, giving off what he described as “paternal” vibes: “I think John was looking a little side-eyed, like, ‘Is everything alright? You doing good? Good day? Everything’s alright? Everything’s good at home?”
For Culkin, the fact that there was an adult looking out for him meant a great deal and left a lasting impression.

“It doesn’t happen that often. It actually happened less as time went on,” Culkin shared. “I wish I got more of that in my life. It’s important that I remember that. I remember John caring when not a lot of people did.”
Candy was married to his wife, a ceramist and abstract painter, Rosemary Margaret Hobor, for 15 years. Together, they had two children, Chris and Jennifer
“He was the best dad,” Jennifer told TODAY.com in 2024. “He’d say, ‘Don’t worry what people think about you. Just be your authentic self.’”

title: Orlando Bloom Addresses Where Things Stand with Katy Perry After Breakup
summary: Orlando Bloom shared how he's doing in the wake of his breakup with his longtime partner, Katy Perry
story: Orlando Bloom shared how he's doing in the wake of his breakup with his longtime partner, Katy Perry.
Bloom, who's starring in the new boxing film "The Cut," said he is doing well on TODAY on Sept. 5 after he and Perry announced they had split in July.

"I'm great, man. I'm so grateful. We have the most beautiful daughter," Bloom said to TODAY's Craig Melvin. "You know, when you leave everything on the field, like I did in this movie, I feel grateful for all of it. And we're great. We're going to be great. It's nothing but love."
The pair welcomed their daughter, Daisy Dove, in August 2020, following their engagement in 2019.
Reps for Bloom, 48, and Perry, 40, issued a joint statement to TODAY.com on July 3 confirming the pair had ended their nearly 10-year, on-and-off relationship.

“Due to the abundance of recent interest and conversation surrounding Orlando Bloom and Katy Perry’s relationship, representatives have confirmed that Orlando and Katy have been shifting their relationship over the past many months to focus on co-parenting,” the statement said. “They will continue to be seen together as a family, as their shared priority is — and always will be — raising their daughter with love, stability and mutual respect.”

The pair first started dating in 2016, though they separated in 2017, before getting back together about a year later. Bloom proposed on Valentine's Day in 2019, but the couple had to postpone their wedding plans due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Perry announced her pregnancy in March 2020 in the music video for her song, “Never Worn White,” and welcomed her first child in August 2020.
Bloom is also dad to his son, Flynn, whom he shares with his ex-wife, model Miranda Kerr.
Kerr weighed in on Bloom and Perry's split in an interview on “Kyle & Jackie O” on Sept. 3, saying she recently spent time with the former couple in honor of their daughter's birthday on Aug. 26.
“I actually just saw them both on the weekend,” Kerr said. “We were celebrating Daisy’s birthday.”
“We’re one big, happy family,” she added. “Katy is amazing. I love her. And Orlando, obviously.”
Since the breakup, Perry has continued on with her "Lifetimes Tour," while Bloom has focused on his role in "The Cut," which premieres in theaters on Sept. 5.

title: Charlie Sheen, Denise Richards Have Rare Red Carpet Reunion Nearly 20 Years After Divorce
summary: Charlie Sheen and ex-wife Denise Richards reunited on the red carpet for the premiere of his Netflix documentary, “aka Charlie Sheen.” They share two daughters.
story: Charlie Sheen and ex-wife Denise Richards came together to help celebrate the premiere of Sheen’s new Netflix documentary, “aka Charlie Sheen.”
The couple posed for pictures together on the red carpet outside the Tudum Theater on Sept. 4, 2025, in Los Angeles. The pair hadn’t been on a red carpet together since 2005.

Sheen and Richards, who are parents to daughters Sami, 21, and Lola, 20, married in 2002 before she filed for divorce in 2005, amid intense media scrutiny and trouble at home. The marriage officially ended in 2006.

Sheen and Richards may not have been on a red carpet for two decades, but they shared the screen together more recently when Sheen appeared on an episode of Richards’ Bravo reality show, “Denise Richards & Her Wild Things,” in April with Lola.

“You know what’s so funny?” Lola told her parents while they had dinner at a restaurant. “I could never picture you guys being married. Sometimes I think about if you were still married and we all lived in the same house.”
“We would have had fun,” Richards said. “Right, Charles? We would’ve.”
“Sure, we would’ve,” Sheen concurred.
Richards, who filed for divorce from second husband Aaron Phypers in July, enjoyed the experience of getting together with Sheen and their daughter.
“I’m so glad we all had dinner. We should do it more often. People would think we’re f------ nuts saying that,” she said.
The "Young Guns" star has previously said he and Richards had managed to settle their differences.
“We’re absolutely friendly,” he told People in 2023.

“We went through so much s--- together that I don’t think either one of us has any energy left to be divisive,” he said. “The only thing that matters is the kids. We knew we had to park our nonsense and focus on the children, because they had nothing to do with any of our crud.”
Sheen reiterated how vital it was for them to make sure their kids remained their priority.

“Even in the hottest portions of depths of the inferno, we were still able to maintain a perspective that yes, the children need to come first,” he said. “Now we’re super friendly, and we’re actually able to process so much of it through humor these days.”
“aka Charlie Sheen” will be available to stream Sept. 10.

“Actor Charlie Sheen tells his story in this candid two-part documentary tracing his dazzling Hollywood rise, tabloid-topping fall and road to recovery,” Netflix says about the project, which features interviews with him, Richards and his other ex-wife Brooke Mueller. The two-part documentary also has interviews with Heidi Fleiss, Ramon Estevez and Sean Penn, as well as Sheen's “Two and a Half Men” co-star Jon Cryer, according to Tudum.

title: 'The Kelly Clarkson Show' Reveals Season 7 Premiere Date, Celebrity Guests
summary: “The Kelly Clarkson Show” is just weeks away from returning for its seventh season.
story: “The Kelly Clarkson Show” is just weeks away from returning for its seventh season.
The NBC talk show announced in a press release that it will resume filming for Season 7 next week starting Monday, Sept. 8, with new episodes set to begin airing Monday, Sept. 29.
The press release also revealed the group of celebrity guests who will appear in upcoming episodes, including Emily Blunt, Marion Cotillard and Colin Farrell.

Some more famous faces slated to make their way to Clarkson’s New York City set are Scarlett Johansson, Dwayne Johnson, Matthew McConaughey, Lionel Richie, Julia Roberts, Shonda Rhimes, Margot Robbie, Sylvester Stallone, Channing Tatum and Reese Witherspoon.

Viewers should expect an emotional return for the daytime talk show, as the press release revealed “Season 7 premiere week will spotlight the heroes who rescued campers from the devastating flood in Texas in July.”
But, fans can also anticipate a season filled with more joyful, music-filled moments that the show has become known for.

“This season fans can look forward to more entertaining panel interviews, exclusive celebrity moments, surprise musical performances and the return of the wildly popular ‘Kellyoke’ segment, where Clarkson highlights extraordinary emerging and established artists and delivers show-stopping covers of hits spanning every genre, backed by her band, Y’All,” the press release said.

title: Princess Diana's Hairdresser Slams Criticism of Kate Middleton's Hair
summary: Princess Diana's former hairstylist is slamming "evil" comments criticizing Catherine, Princess of Wales' new blond look
story: Princess Diana's former hairstylist is slamming "evil" comments criticizing Catherine, Princess of Wales' new blond look.

Sam McKnight, who was Diana’s hairstylist from 1990 until her tragic death in 1997, defended the former Kate Middleton after she debuted a longer blond hair style when she and husband Prince William visited the Natural History Museum in London on Sept. 4.

"I am shocked, horrified, dismayed and disgusted by all the nasty comments about the Princess of Wales today. A woman’s hair is very personal to her, it’s armour, defence, confidence and so much more," McKnight wrote in a message he posted the same day on Instagram.

“I cannot believe how evil and lacking in any kind of empathy are the comments, the majority made apparently by other women, attacking a vulnerable other young woman, who has no choice, by dint of who she married, and the role she took on, to bravely face the public," he continued.
McKnight went on to reference Kate’s 2024 cancer diagnosis in his message, saying he believed the mom of three would prefer to "be away from the public arena."

"She has brilliantly and quietly, unselfishly represented our country, the soft power we still have as a nation," he wrote, adding, "Cancer affects individuals differently, but is life-changing for everyone. So FFS LEAVE HER ALONE. SHAME ON YOU."
Kate announced in March 2024 that she had been diagnosed with an unspecified form of cancer.  She later shared in January 2025 that she was in remission.

The debut of Kate's new longer blond hair comes two months after she visited patients at a hospital in Essex, England, on July 2. While at the hospital, Kate spoke candidly to patients about her cancer journey.

“You put on a sort of brave face (with) stoicism through treatment. (When) treatment’s done, then it’s like, ‘I can crack on, get back to normal again,’” she said, according to video footage from the BBC.

“But," she added, "actually the phase afterwards is really difficult, you’re not necessarily under the clinical team any longer, but you’re not able to function normally at home as you perhaps once used to."

Cancer, she told the patients, can be hard on the patient and also his or her loved ones. "Through first diagnosis or post treatment and things like that, it is a life-changing experience both for the patient but also for the families as well," said Kate.

“You have to find your new normal and that takes time," she said, adding, "and it’s a rollercoaster. It’s not one smooth plane, which you expect it to be. But the reality is it’s not, you go through hard times."

title: ‘Golden Bachelor’ Season 2: Get to Know Mel Owens’ 23 Contestants
summary: The ladies of “The Golden Bachelor” Season 2 have arrived. Meet the 23 women competing to win Mel Owens' heart.
story: The ladies of “The Golden Bachelor” Season 2 have arrived!

On Sept. 4, a few weeks before the “Golden” spin-off returns for its sophomore season, ABC released the names of the contestants who will compete for Mel Owens’ heart. The network also released a video that shows each woman sharing fun facts about herself and explaining why she signed up for the show.
One contestant named Nicolle, a 64-year-old yoga instructor from Miami Beach, Florida, says in the clip about the “Golden” ladies, “I think we’re more beautiful, sexy, vibrant than ever.”

“The Golden Bachelor,” which debuted in 2023 with Gerry Turner as the first lead, follows contestants in their golden years looking for love. Season 2 will follow Mel, a newcomer to Bachelor Nation, as he dates women from ages 58 to 77. His season begins with a two-hour premiere on Wednesday, Sept. 24, at 8 p.m. ET on ABC.

Mel, a 66-year-old retired NFL player who now works as a lawyer, was announced as the season's leading man in April. But, he's since then sparked controversy after he said he wasn’t interested in dating women his own age.

“They asked me, ‘What’s your preferences?’ So I just said, ‘45 to 60,’ just being honest,” he said on the University of Michigan Athletics’ podcast, “In the Trenches,” in June. “And then the process went and I was selected and then we had lunch with the executive producer. I said, ‘You know, if they’re 60 or over, I’m cutting them.’”
He also said, “They got to be fit because I’m staying in shape and work out and stuff. And I told them, ‘Try to stay away from the artificial hips and the wigs.’”
He later revealed in an interview with Glamour that he apologized to the contestants for his remarks during the first night of filming.

“I apologized to the women on the show. When I first walked in, I addressed it. I apologized to them. I said, ‘It was unfair, insensitive. I want to earn it back. Just give me the chance.’ And hopefully, these last two weeks I earned some of that back,’” said Owens, who was in the middle of filming at the time.

How will they react? We’ll have to wait until the first episode airs to find out. For now, meet the 23 “Golden” ladies hoping to receive a rose from Mel Owens. Plus, learn what they reveal about themselves in the introduction video and in their official bios.
The Cast of ‘The Golden Bachelor’ Season 2...
Alexandra, 67
Occupation: Luxury yacht sales representative
Hometown: Miami, Florida
More about Alexandra: “If I am attracted to the brain of the gentleman, I’m attracted to everything else,” Alexandra said. “If he holds my hand and I feel butterflies, we have a great future.”
Amy, 63
Occupation: Full-time mom
Hometown: Short Hills, New Jersey
More about Amy: Amy is a “momager” to her twin daughters, who are “internet-famous,” according to her ABC bio. Outside of work, she likes to exercise, cook and dance.
Andra, 77
Occupation: Retired federal worker
Hometown: Los Angeles, California

More about Andra: If Andra looks familiar to members of Bachelor Nation, that's because she is the twin sister of “Golden Bachelor” Season 1 fan-favorite Sandra Mason. Andra enjoys crafting, spending time with her grandson, going to the gym and any adrenaline-filled activity.
Carla, 62
Occupation: Former model
Hometown: Los Angeles, California

More about Carla: Carla is a big believer in chemistry at first sight but said finding a connection in Los Angeles has been challenging. In her free time, she likes to read autobiographies and travel. She previously went on a solo safari in Tanzania.
Carol, 63
Occupation: Family manager for Los Angeles Dodgers star Freddie Freeman, her nephew
Hometown: Villa Park, California
More about Carol: Carol enjoys hiking, listening to Bad Bunny and playing the tambourine. She is a mom of three daughters and recently returned to college.
Cheryl, 66
Occupation: Retired from the IRS
Hometown: Englewood, Colorado
More about Cheryl: “My spirit is still young,” Cheryl said. “I race motocross.”
Cindy, 60
Occupation: Retired biomedical engineer
Hometown: Austin, Texas
More about Cindy: “We have a lot of living to do, and I’m looking for a partner to join me,” Cindy says about her golden years.
Debbie, 65
Occupation: Fitness professional
Hometown: Denver, Colorado

More about Debbie: “One of my proudest accomplishments is my fitness program,” Debbie said in her intro video. She described her program as “one of the longest-selling info commercials in history.” She also shared that she “absolutely believes in love at first sight.”
Diane, 71
Occupation: Librarian
Hometown: Wasilla, Alaska
More about Diane: Diane plays women’s hockey, has won three triathlons and is a huge Dolly Parton fan.
Gerri, 64
Occupation: Home care agency CEO
Hometown: Rockville, Maryland

More about Gerri: Gerri has dedicated her life to working in the health care industry for over 35 years, including being an ICU nurse during the COVID-19 pandemic. She is a proud mom and grandmother who likes to fish and play with her teacup Yorkie named Godiva.
Lily, 72
Occupation: Retired elementary school teacher
Hometown: Pacific Palisades, California
More about Lily: Lily wants her love story to resemble a romance novel. She hopes that her future partner likes to dance as she performs with a dance troupe called the Ole Skool Crew.
Lisa, 66
Occupation: State park employee
Hometown: Marion, Ohio

More about Lisa: As a state park employee, Lisa is passionate about taking care of animals and has rescued multiple cats. She is ready to leave her small town, where she describes dating as “nonexistent,” and see if Mel Owens is the one for her.
Maia, 58
Occupation: College sports consultant
Hometown: Malibu, California

More about Maia: “What do I say to those people? You’re crazy!” she responded when asked about how she would react to someone who says she is too old to find love. In her spare time, Maia can be found playing pickleball, going to concerts and driving up the California coast.
Monica B., 62
Occupation: Flight attendant
Hometown: Huntsville, Alabama
More about  Monica B.: When she isn’t flying all over the world, Monica B. spends her days caring for her four grandchildren, visiting farmers markets and doing yoga in the park.
Monica P., 60
Occupation: Cosmetic dentist
Hometown: Birmingham, Alabama
More about Monica P.: Monica P. likes to spend her time snow skiing, water skiing, singing karaoke, playing board games and going to Pilates classes.
Mylene, 61
Occupation: Casino VIP host
Hometown: Las Vegas, Nevada

More about Mylene: Mylene was born and raised in the Philippines before she relocated to Japan and eventually made her way to Las Vegas. She is a fan of Bruno Mars and would love to go skydiving one day.
Nicolle, 64
Occupation: Yoga teacher
Hometown: Miami Beach, Florida

More about Nicolle: When asked by a producer how she would reply to critics who think she is “too old for love,” Nicolle had an honest response. “You know, what I want to say is f--- them,” she replied before flipping off the camera with both hands. She laughed and added, “But that’s not what I’m going to say.”
Peg, 62
Occupation: Retired firefighter and bomb tech
Hometown: Las Vegas, Nevada
More about Peg: Peg was a firefighter for 22 years before spending 13 years defusing bombs. “So, Mel doesn’t scare me,” she cheekily said.
Robin, 63
Occupation: Wealth adviser/ Vineyard owner
Hometown: Napa Valley, California
More about Robin: Robin likes to watch football, ride her motorcycle and tap dance. She also started her own wine label.
Roxanne, 62
Occupation: Longevity nurse
Hometown: Austin, Texas
More about Roxanne: Roxanne said that getting older is all about gaining wisdom. “Even though I am 62, I am full of life,” she said.
Susie, 62
Occupation: Realtor
Hometown: Del Mar, California
More about Susie: Susie said she believes, “Life begins in the golden years.” The mom of three is looking for a spontaneous man who wants to travel.
Terri, 71
Occupation: Cosmetic dentist
Hometown: Houston, Texas

More about Terri: Terri said that she views her golden years as still having her whole life ahead of her. She is a longtime “Bachelor” fan and has watched the show since it began in 2002. She also taught herself to be a ventriloquist and studied zoology in college.
Tracy, 62
Occupation: Interior designer
Hometown: Lafayette, Louisiana
More about Tracy: Tracy loves to dance, with one of her favorite styles being the Jitterbug. Her style icon is Audrey Hepburn.

title: Legendary Rock Group Offers to Be Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce’s Wedding Band
summary: Foreigner wrote an Instagram post offering to serve as the wedding band at Taylor Swift's wedding to Travis Kelce.
story: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce could go from "Anti-Hero" to "Juke Box Hero."
Foreigner has announced it would be happy to serve as the wedding band for the couple, who set off a frenzy after they announced their engagement last month.
“An open letter to @taylorswift and @killatrav…” the band captioned a note it posted on its Instagram page on Sept. 3.

“Dear Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce, we know what love is,” the post began, alluding to the band's 1984 megahit “I Want to Know What Love Is,” which earned a Grammy nomination for best pop performance by a duo or group with vocal.
“We spent 40 years figuring it out ... and now you guys have too,” the band continued. “Please accept this as our formal offer to be your wedding band. Best wishes, Foreigner.”
The prospect of Foreigner playing the wedding was met with widespread reaction.
“😂😂😂😂😂,” Flavor Flav wrote in the comments.
“Wow this is amazing, what a gift!!! Hope they accept!! I definitely would! 😍,” another person wrote.
“Oh my goodness please do this y’all,” begged one fan.
“Y’all are too cool for them! Come on,” someone else commented.
“Taylor and Travis are celebrities, you’re Legends,” raved another person.

Aside from “I Want to Know What Love Is,” Foreigner’s stable of hits includes “Waiting for a Girl Like You,” “Juke Box Hero,” “Hot Blooded,” “Urgent” and “Feels Like the First Time.” The band was inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame in 2024 after a push from other artists who voiced their support.
Foreigner is keeping busy these days, too. The band is currently touring the United States and will head to Europe next June for nearly a month’s worth of dates.
There’s no word whether Swift and Kelce plan to look at the offer and shake it off or if they’re actually into making Foreigner part of their love story.

title: Jamie Lee Curtis Shares the 1 Thing Her Husband 'Cooks' For Her: 'Our Love Language'
summary: Christopher Guest only knows how to make one simple sandwich, according to Jamie Lee Curtis.
story: Christopher Guest only knows how to make one simple sandwich, according to Jamie Lee Curtis.
Luckily it's her favorite one.
Curtis shared on "The Late Show" with Stephen Colbert on Sept. 3 that her husband of 40 years may be limited in the kitchen, but he knows the perfect way to her heart.
She was asked during a segment what she thinks is the best kind of sandwich.
"Peanut butter and jelly," she said. "PB&J. It is the only thing Christopher Guest knows how to make. It is our love language."
Curtis, 66, and Guest, 77, celebrated their 40th wedding anniversary in December 2024.

The Oscar-winning actor and the director of “Best in Show” and “Waiting for Guffman” have made laughter a central feature of their long-lasting relationship. She said on TODAY in 2024 that Guest still makes her laugh “more than any human being."
“I’m sure there’s something about me that he likes. I don’t know what it is, but I’m sure there’s something,” she joked.
The parents of two got married only months after Curtis first saw a picture of Guest in Rolling Stone magazine in 1984.
“I said out loud to my friend, the late, great Debra Hill, ‘Oh, I’m going to marry that guy,'" Curtis said in Interview Magazine.
She then ran into him at a restaurant and they had their first date.
“It was a moment of just knowing. This feeling of, ‘This is the real thing,’ and knowing that,” Guest said on Nick Offerman and Megan Mullally’s podcast.
While the two do enjoy a good PB&J sandwich, that might be one of the few things they have in common.

“My husband and I are opposites. We have been for 33 years, and we always will be,” Curtis told Good Housekeeping in 2018. “He’s an intellectual, and I was from the movie star/alcoholic/drug addict side, where ­education was not the most important thing. We don’t listen to the same radio station, we don’t read the same paper, we don’t go to bed at the same time.”

title: 'The Paper' Season 1 Ending Leaves Relationships Up in the Air
summary: "The Paper" is a spinoff of "The Office," with a new team of personalities including Ned, Esmeralda, Mare and Oscar. Find out what happens in the Season 1 finale.
story: Spoilers ahead for the Season 1 finale of “The Paper”
It’s the biggest night in journalism — in Ohio to be exact, and “The Paper”s revitalized Toledo Truth Teller is nominated for three awards.

Created by the man behind “The Office” Greg Daniels and Michael Koman (“Nathan For You”), “The Paper” is a Peacock mockumentary series about a group of dedicated journalists who — led by an optimistic editor-in-chief, Ned Sampson, played by Domhnall Gleeson — aim to save their local newspaper from turning into a worthless pile of clickbait articles.

The 10-episode sitcom introduces a new crew of personalities, each trying their best to contribute, while one in particular is unafraid to sabotage Ned's efforts: managing editor Esmeralda, played by Sabrina Impacciatore.
Ahead of its premiere, it was announced that the show was picked up for a second season.
Here is what happens in the Season 1 finale of “The Paper.”
The Toledo Truth Teller Is Nominated at the Ohio Journalism Awards, Chaos Ensues

In the Season 1 finale, Mare (Chelsea Frei) is nominated for an Ohio Journalism Award for her piece on the Softies clog, Ned for the Truth Teller and Oscar (Oscar Nuñez) for best new game for his Mr. Digit Puzzle.

While Mare and Oscar can’t contain their excitement at the Ohio Journalism Awards, Ned keeps reminding his staff that he doesn’t care about winning — even though he’s obsessively rubbing a “rabbit’s foot” made from a childhood stuffy for good luck. His anxieties are made worse after Mare introduces popular YouTube star Theo (Chris Witaske) as her date.

When Ken (Tim Key) and Esmeralda discover they’re not sitting at the same table as their publisher Marv (Allan Harvey), they’re both slighted. Fearing for his job, Ken makes a point to “save” Marv by the end of the night, going so far as engineering a way to provoke him to choke.
Unfortunately for Ken, Oscar is the hero who gives both Marv and his brother the Heimlich. Since Esmeralda also wasn’t nominated for any awards that evening, she feels snubbed on both accounts.

After Mare and Oscar both win, Esmeralda decides to steal the spotlight during the award show’s in memoriam and sings an impromptu song about the “sad, dead journalists” who made their “final deadline.”

Viewers may recognize Impacciatore from Season 2 of “White Lotus” as the stern resort manager Valentina. If you thought Valentina gave Mia and Lucia a hard time at the hotel, Impacciatore says Valentina would not stand one bit for Esmeralda’s flair for dramatics.

“Valentina wouldn’t even allow Esmeralda to get in,” Impacciatore tells TODAY.com, while discussing how these two characters would interact. “But Esmeralda would for sure try to find a way to take the place of Valentina.”
One Relationship Ends on a Low Point

Nicole (Ramona Young) discovers that her situationship with Detrick (MelvinGregg) isn't so casual. She finds out that he isn’t dating anyone else and feels tricked into a monogamous relationship. Upset with Nicole’s commitment issues, Detrick breaks up with her. Nicole argues they weren’t in a true relationship to justify an actual breakup, but Detrick counters that it was real to him.
Speaking with TODAY.com, Ramona Young says what excited her most about her character’s relationship with Detrick throughout the season was the nuances it brought.

“I like the unknown and the messiness of it,” Young says, adding it gave her the chance to explore a new acting point of view since her past roles tended to be her pinning after others, not the other way around. “It’s interesting to play a different perspective as an actor and wrap my head around something unfamiliar.”
Though Nicole and Detrick’s relationship ends at a low point in the finale, Gregg shares an optimistic, yet realistic viewpoint for their characters.
“I hope they find clarity, but Detrick’s heart is going to come at a price in season two,” Gregg says. “She’s going to have to work for it.”
Ned and Mare Explore Their Feelings for Each Other
All season long, tension grew between Ned and Mare.

Wanting to help her editor-in-chief prepare his acceptance speech, Mare ushers him away from the ceremony where they stumble upon a wedding reception. Ned practices his speech as they hit the dance floor, but when the bride and groom kick them out for crashing, they lose hotel access and are locked out. As luck would have it, Ned is nowhere in sight when the Ohio Journalism Awards announce his win for outstanding print coverage.

Seizing the opportunity, Ken and Esmeralda accept on his behalf. Though, no one can understand them because they spend the whole time talking over each other. Before Ken and Esmeralda can get into a fight over the award, Ned arrives and starts delivering a heartfelt speech — that is, until Esmeralda “faints.” Don’t worry, she’s fine. In fact, the documentary crew catches her smiling as everyone rushes to her side.

At the end of the night, Oscar shares relationship advice with Ned that makes him reconsider telling Mare how he really feels. Soon after, Ned rushes to Mare’s door and hands her the speech he wrote. Mare says it’s not a good time, leading Ned to assume she's still with Theo. However, she reveals it’s because Nicole is crying in her hotel room over her breakup with Detrick.

In the end, Ned and Mare’s journalistic integrity kicks in and they decide they must kiss for research purposes, hoping if they “get it out of the way,” they could go back to being friends. But if Ned’s “oh, s---” response tells us anything, it’s that there is a lot more to unpack come Season 2.
Frei, who plays Mare, tells TODAY.com her and Gleeson’s final scene could have ended without any lip action.

“Because Donald’s character is so by the book and wants to be a good boss, we filmed it a million different ways. They kiss. They didn’t kiss. They get into a fight,” she says of the different approaches. “So it was really cool to see that (the directors) ended up choosing the kiss.”
For Frei, Chelsea's budding romance with Ned reminded her of another relationship in her life.

“It’s funny because my parents met on a construction site,” Frei says. “My dad was the boss, and my mom was the secretary. I know it’s ridiculous, but they’re still together over 30 years later. So, what are you going to do? It works.”
Fans will get to see in Season 2 of “The Paper” if Ned and Mare’s relationship has what it takes to follow suit.

title: Japan's Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba to step down
summary: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba has decided to resign to avoid a split within the ruling Liberal Democratic Party, public broadcaster NHK said on Sunday.
story: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announced his resignation Sunday, plunging the world’s fourth largest economy and a key U.S. ally into fresh political uncertainty amid rising living costs and growing tensions in the region.

“I have consistently stated that I do not intend to cling to this position, and that I would make a decision at the appropriate time after accomplishing what needed to be done,” he told a press conference.
Ishiba finalized details of a trade deal with the U.S. last week, under which Japan pledged $550 billion of investments in return for lower tariffs on its auto sector.
Ishiba called the Trump administration’s tariff measures a “national crisis,” but said negotiations had now reached a conclusion, allowing him to step aside.
“I believe this is precisely the appropriate timing,” he added. “I have therefore decided to step aside and make way for my successor.”
Ishiba said he had instructed his Liberal Democratic Party to hold an emergency leadership race, adding he would continue in the role until a successor was elected.

Since Ishiba took office last year, his LDP-led coalition lost its majority in elections for both houses of parliament amid voter anger over living costs, including a historic defeat in an election for Japan’s upper house in July.
He had faced growing calls to resign, mostly from right-wing opponents within his own party, which has governed Japan for almost all of the postwar era.
Ishiba said responsibility for the election results “rests with myself as the president of the party.”

Requests for an early leadership election or Ishiba’s resignation gained further traction last week when the LDP adopted a review of its upper house loss in July, which called for “a complete overhaul” of the party.
His party was scheduled to vote Monday on holding an early leadership election, a virtual no-confidence motion against Ishiba if approved.

title: Fate of Ukrainian children kidnapped by Russia hangs in the balance as talks falter
summary: KYIV, Ukraine — Armed with machine guns, balaclava-clad Russian soldiers burst into 16-year-old Vladislav Rudenko’s home in the city of Kherson in southern Ukraine and gave him half an hour to gather some things.“I was home alone.
story: KYIV, Ukraine — Armed with machine guns, balaclava-clad Russian soldiers burst into 16-year-old Vladislav Rudenko’s home in the city of Kherson in southern Ukraine and gave him half an hour to gather some things.

“I was home alone. I packed my things in a panic,” the teenager told NBC News, describing the morning in October 2022, eight months after Russian forces captured the city, when he said the soldiers forced him to get into a car and drove away “in an unknown direction.”

It was the start of an eight-month nightmare as the teenager became part of a systematic effort by Russia to relocate and re-educate thousands of children from Ukraine, in some cases forcibly adopting them while sending others to military training camps.

At a meeting with President Donald Trump and several European leaders at the White House last month, Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskyy raised the issue of Ukraine’s "abducted children.” His comments came three days after Trump met with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin in Alaska for talks on ending the war.

While little progress has been made toward a ceasefire since then, Mykola Kuleba, the founder of Save Ukraine, a leading nongovernmental organization supporting people trying to secure the return of their children from Russian, insisted world leaders’ “focus must remain on children, not just land.”

Kuleba, whose organization says it has rescued more than 750 children from Russia and Ukrainian territories occupied by its forces, says the push for their removal and re-education came from the highest levels of the Kremlin.

The International Criminal Court has accused Putin of the war crime of overseeing the unlawful abduction and deportation of children from Ukraine to Russia, and in March 2023 it issued a warrant for his arrest. The ICC has also accused Maria Alekseyevna Lvova-Belova, Putin’s presidential commissioner for children’s rights, of committing similar crimes.
“They force these kids to be Russian, to be Russian soldiers,” Kuleba said in a telephone interview last month, adding: “The Russian regime has a clear intention to annihilate Ukrainian identity.”
NBC News has reached out to Russia’s defense ministry and Lvova-Belova’s office for comment on both Vlad’s abduction and the ICC arrest warrants.

Vlad said he was taken to two camps in Crimea, the Black Sea peninsula that Russia seized from Ukraine and annexed in 2014, and later to a naval academy in the Kherson region occupied by Putin’s forces.
“They tried to break me in every possible way,” he said, adding that he was treated “very badly” and denied food in the first camp because he “began to show my pro-Ukrainian position.”

On one occasion, he said, he “took down the Russian flag and hung my underwear there.” This led to him being thrown into solitary confinement for a week, he said, adding that his captors “fed me twice a day, did not allow me to communicate with anyone at all.”
Another time, he said, the head of security at one of the camps tore a girl’s T-shirt and trampled on it because it bore Ukraine’s coat of arms.

In regular classes with other Ukrainian children whose ages ranged from 6 to 18, he said, “We learned everything about Russia only, the history of Russia and so on,” adding that they also talked about recent events in the war, like what Ukrainian territories had been captured.
“I understood that Russia is an aggressor country and it took away my childhood and severed my contacts with my family so that I would not see them,” he said.
On the morning of his capture, Vlad said, he had managed to call his mother, Tatiana, 38, to tell her that he had been kidnapped.

Tatiana said she wasn’t home when he was taken because she had been taken to the Russian commandant’s office to write a statement about her mother, Rudenko Tamara, 53, who died in an attack the previous day. They wanted her to say “that Ukraine killed my mother,” she said.

On the call, Tatiana said, Vlad told her he was in the city of Olezhky and was “going to Crimea to rest,” which left her bewildered. “At that moment we just had a little fight,” she added. “I simply told him, ‘How could you leave your family at such a difficult time?’ I didn’t know any details.”
Along with other parents, she only realized much later that Russian soldiers had been coaching children to say they were being evacuated from bombing and sent to summer camps.

With fighting intense in Kherson, even after Russian forces were pushed out of the city in November 2022, Tatiana said that the month after the kidnapping, she decided to move west to the city of Mykolaiv.

Together with her husband, Olexsandr, 43, who is also Vlad’s stepfather, she left the city with her other five biological children, including baby Stefania, who was less than a year old at the time. NBC News agreed not to use Oleksandr’s last name as he was called up to Ukraine’s army in February 2023 and is still serving. Her sister and her cousin joined them as they made their way west to the city of Mykolaiv.

Although Vlad’s phone was routinely checked by his Russian captors, Tatiana said, she was able to keep in touch with her son through occasional text messages, but she “told him not to create problems.”
“I said when you can, if you are there alone or no one is escorting you, then write,” she said, adding that she was able to establish he was being held in a camp in Lazurne in southeast Ukraine.

After a friend told her about Save Ukraine, Tatiana said, she reached out to the organization, which after several months of planning arranged for her to travel to Russia along with six other women whose children had been taken.
With no direct route across the front lines, Tatiana said, she traveled through Poland, Belarus and Russia’s capital, Moscow, before she was eventually able to travel to the camp via Crimea.
No one from Save Ukraine accompanied the group, she said, but its representatives were in touch by phone and arranged for her to be put up by a volunteer in a temporary home.

Although she was roughly searched by masked men on arrival, Tatiana said, things initially seemed to be going well. But on the second day, she said, agents from the Federal Security Service (FSB), the successor to the KGB spy agency, came around, put a mask over her head and took her somewhere for questioning, after “confiscating my documents and my phone.”

“They interrogated me, maybe six or seven hours,” she said, adding that she was locked in a basement cell overnight before further questioning the following morning. Her interrogators were particularly interested in Save Ukraine, she said.
They also brought a cameraman and a journalist, who she said expected her to say “how great Russia is, how it helps us and how bad Ukraine is for us.”

While she was initially reluctant, she said, she was able to use Vlad’s phone to consult with Save Ukraine via text message. Tatiana said the group told her: “Do what is necessary, just for you to leave from there.”
NBC News has reached out to the FSB for comment.
After giving the interview on camera, she said, she was released with Vlad and allowed to make the arduous journey home.
“It was just happiness after the horror. … I was simply amazed,” Tatiana said.

Kidnapped children are now spread out across approximately 200 locations from the Black Sea to Russia’s Pacific coast, according to Nathaniel Raymond, the executive director of the Yale School of Public Health’s Humanitarian Research Lab (HRL), the leading body tracking kidnapped Ukrainian children.
The group has monitored the movement of children by analyzing satellite photos and photographing airplanes and vehicles apparently used to transport the kids, among other techniques.
“They don’t all come from the same place. They don’t all go to the same place. They don’t all have the same purpose,” Raymond said in a telephone interview last month.

Sens. Lindsey Graham, R-S.C., and Richard Blumenthal, D-Conn., have floated the possibility of introducing a bill in the Senate that, if passed, could designate Russia and Belarus as state sponsors of terrorism over the kidnapping of Ukrainian children, a source familiar with the bill told NBC News in mid-August. A draft of the bill says that Belarus “has directly supported the kidnapping of Ukrainian children and supported their relocation.”
But both Save Ukraine and HRL took a financial hit last spring after the Trump administration cut funding for their programs.
As Russia pushes to take control of more Ukrainian territory, rescuing the Ukrainian children has become an even more urgent issue, experts say.
“That’s all the more reason to get all the kids we can back before the door closes,” Raymond said.
“Now is the decisive moment when America cannot allow itself to step back,” added Kuleba, of Save Ukraine.
As for Vlad, who is now 19, he said thinking about his family kept him going during his time in captivity, and he rushed to see his baby sister Stefania as soon as he got home.
Now in Ukraine’s capital, Kyiv, he is hoping to become a sports trainer.
“What helped me all the time was probably that I had family in Ukraine,” he said. “And I could return to Ukraine and build a normal future.
Daryna Mayer reported from Kyiv and Babak Dehghanpisheh from New York.

title: Pope Leo canonizes 'God's influencer,' the Catholic Church's first millennial saint
summary: Pope Leo XIV declared 15-year-old Carlo Acutis the first millennial saint at an open-air Mass attended by tens of thousands of people in the Vatican’s St.
story: Pope Leo XIV declared 15-year-old Carlo Acutis the first millennial saint at an open-air Mass attended by tens of thousands of people in the Vatican’s St. Peter’s Square on Sunday.
Informally known as “God’s influencer,” Acutis was just 15 when he died of acute promyelocytic leukemia in Milan in 2006 and has two miracles attributed to him by the Catholic Church.
